name: Docular. Create GDPR-ready privacy policies and terms & conditions for your site quickly and easily.
author: Docular

sections.description:
Docular helps you to create GDPR-ready legal documents for your site quickly and easily.

The Docular library contains over 50 different website T&Cs and privacy policy templates. All the templates are up to date with the latest developments in English law, including the General Data Protection Regulation or GDPR. Many of the templates are available free of charge.

Free documents include:

  • Privacy policies
  • Cookies policies
  • Website disclaimers
  • Website terms and conditions

Premium documents include:

  • Terms and conditions for social networks
  • Terms and conditions of sale
  • Delivery policies
  • Download terms and conditions
  • Booking terms and conditions
  • Acceptable use policies

You can use Docular’s online editor to adapt the templates to suit your site. Editing controls and guidance notes mean that even non-lawyers can produce professional legal documents using Docular.

If you create a Docular account and install this plugin on your site, you will be able to display the latest versions of your Docular documents on the site without the need to copy and format text.

Key features of Docular include:

  • All templates drafted by senior lawyers.
  • Controlled editing vs power mode.
  • Automated numbering, cross-references and punctuation.
  • Secure cloud storage of documents.
  • Document exports in a range of formats.
  • Display on WordPress sites with shortcodes.

If you have any questions about the Docular service or this plugin, then please do get in touch.

From within WordPress

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’.
  2. Search for ‘Docular’.
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

Manually

  1. Download the latest version of the plugin.
  2. Unzip the downloaded file to your computer.
  3. Upload the /docular/ directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory of your site.
  4. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

After activation

  1. Go to https://docular.net/pages/api and sign up for free to Docular and start browsing for GDPR-ready privacy policies and terms and conditions.
  2. Click the Docular link in the Admin menu of your site and follow the simple instructions there.
sections.faq:
What is this plugin for?

This plugin enables the display of legal documents created on Docular on WordPress websites.

What is Docular?

Docular is a web application that allows users to create professional-grade legal documentation (including website T&Cs and privacy policies) with relative ease.

What types of document will I find on Docular?

Docular includes 45+ different sets of T&Cs for websites, and 5+ different privacy policy templates.

At present, the entire library consists of English law documents, and depending upon the circumstances in which they are used, documents may need to be adapted to take account of the rules of different legal systems.

Will the documents help me with GDPR compliance?

All Docular documents have been updated to reflect the requirements of the GDPR. Specifically, the data processing clauses in the Docular library have been updated to reflect the requirements of Article 28 of the GDPR, and the privacy policies have been updated to reflect the GDPR’s data controller disclosure requirements.

Where do the documents come from? Can I trust them?

All the Docular documents are written by highly experienced lawyers (or where appropriate, other professionals) specialising in the relevant field.

Are the documents updated regularly?

Yes – indeed they are updated much more often than most template libraries. In a typical year, around half the documents in the library will be updated to reflect changes in law and practice.

Will Docular save me time?

It typically takes less than half the time to produce a legal document using Docular, as compared with editing a good template using word processing software.

What if I need highly customised T&Cs?

Docular has two editing modes. The standard editing mode reduces the scope for error; the power editing mode allows you to change almost anything in the document.

Where are my Docular documents saved?

Your edited documents are stored on our cloud servers, but you can download them any time you like in a range of different formats.
sections.changelog:
1.1.0

  • Update to API authentication method. Some users on shared hosts experienced some issues with their domain matching the one set in their Docular API Domain Key. The new v2 Docular API uses a Client Secret to authenticate alongside an API Domain Key. This improves authentication stability.

1.0.1

  • Improvements to error handling. If there is an API error it now displays on the admin page.

1.0

  • First release of the Docular plugin.

short_description: Docular helps you to create GDPR-ready legal documents for your site quickly and easily. This plugin makes it easy to display them on your site.

screenshots.caption: The Docular library contains over 50 different GDPR-ready website T&Cs and privacy policy templates.
The Docular interface is powerful but very easy to use...
...and helps you to produce professional documents.
The plugin is easy to use, and automatically fetches your Doular documents.
Your privacy policy, terms and conditions, and other documents display perfectly on your site.
